Package io.github.moctave.weftspace

Class DataNode

java.lang.Object
io.github.moctave.weftspace.DataNode
Direct Known Subclasses:
LoadedNode
public class DataNode extends Object
A class representing a node in the data tree.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    DataNode.Flag
    The flag attached to this node, influencing how it should be treated during instantiation.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataNode

      public DataNode(String name, DataNode.Flag flag, DataNode parent, List<String> args, List<DataNode> children)
      Primary constructor. Takes all the standard arguments, except those defined by LoadedNode.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of this node, typically the first phrase present on its line.
      flag - A flag indicating how this node should be treated during instantiation.
      parent - This node's parent node (or null if it should be the root of its tree).
      args - A list of arguments attached to this node.
      children - A list of nodes which are children of this node.

    • DataNode

      public DataNode()
      A simplified constructor that creates an empty node intended to be used as a root node for the DataReader.

  • Method Details

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Generates a hash code for this node, so that all nodes which are equal have the same hash code. Multiple distinct nodes may have the same hash code, as (1) the mechanics for name.hashCode() and flag.hashCode() are not controlled, (2) parents are not taken into account in this method, and (3) nodes which have themself as a child will not have their children considered.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      A hash code value for this node.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object obj)
      Indicates whether an object is equal to this node, comparing the names, flags, arguments, and children of the two nodes. NOTE: Parents are NOT considered by this method, to reduce complexity. If you need to check if two nodes have identical parents, use sameParent(DataNode)
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to compare this node against.
      Returns:
      true if this node is equal to obj, false otherwise.

    • sameParent

      public boolean sameParent(DataNode node)
      Compares the parent of this node against another node to see if they are equal.
      Parameters:
      node - The node to compare this node against.
      Returns:
      true if this node has the same parent as the other node, false otherwise.

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this node, including name, arguments, and the number of children it has.

      parent

    • setParent

      public void setParent(DataNode parent)
      Setter: Changes this node's parent. This method should be used very cautiously, as it can easily damage the structure of the node tree.
      Parameters:
      parent - This node's new parent.

    • getArgs

      public List<String> getArgs()
      Getter: Returns the full argument list of this node.
      Returns:
      args

    • setArgs

      public void setArgs(List<String> args)
      Setter: Entirely overwrites the arguments of this node.
      Parameters:
      args - The new value for args.

    • getChildren

      public List<DataNode> getChildren()
      Getter: Returns the full list of children of this node.
      Returns:
      children

    • setChildren

      public void setChildren(List<DataNode> children)
      Setter: Entirely overwrites the children of this node. This method should be used very cautiously, as it can easily damage the structure of the node tree.
      Parameters:
      children - The new value for children.
